newsitem.title: USA: CIBCR U.S. leading inflation index 104.3 in April.
newsitem.headline: CIBCR U.S. leading inflation index 104.3 in April.

text.p: The Center for International Business Cycle Research (CIBCR) said its U.S. leading inflation index (LII) fell to 104.3 in April from a revised 105.3 in March.
A stable civilian employment rate, lower number of purchasers reporting higher prices paid and a decline of industrial materials prices helped pull the LII lower, CIBCR said.
"These estimates suggest strongly that U.S. inflation is likely to remain restrained in the near future," it said.
